doc.description:
Model View Controller Class
 *
 *
This class will route a request to the according model and/or view through its controller.
A model and a view can be automatically associated if located in the same directory branch with the same name than the controller in their respective locations
A view can be directly imported in the controller through this very class

tags.todo: Look into the check function and divide it

name: bbn\Mvc\Model

__construct.name: __construct
__construct.summary: Models are always recreated and reincluded, even if they have from the same path
__construct.description: They are all created from bbn\Mvc::get_model

arguments.name: db
arguments.description: The full path to the model's file

check_action.name: check_action

is_controlled_by.name: is_controlled_by

get.name: get

add_inc.name: add_inc
add_inc.summary: Adds a property to the MVC object inc if it has not been declared.

has_data.name: has_data
has_data.summary: Checks if data exists or if a specific index exists in the data

set_data.name: set_data
set_data.summary: Sets the data. Chainable. Should be useless as $this->data is public. Chainable.

add_data.name: add_data
add_data.summary: Merges the existing data if there is with this one. Chainable.

get_from_cache.name: get_from_cache

get_set_from_cache.name: get_set_from_cache

test.name: test
test.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: test
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

check.name: check
check.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

parent.name: check
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

__call.name: __call

parent.name: __call

plugin_data_path.name: plugin_data_path

doc.description: An external object that can be filled after the object creation and can be used as a global with the function add_inc
